intro: Schefflera reticulata subsp. jauaensis, commonly known as the Jauaensis umbrella tree, is a member of the Araliaceae family. It is native to parts of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its large, glossy, palmate leaves that can grow up to 30 cm in diameter. It typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, often reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers followed by red berries, which are an important food source for local wildlife.
